title: The OnePlus 8 is a SEXY Smartphone - Unboxing & First Impressions
description: It's going to be a hard sell to make you want to cover up this smartphone completely with a case.   Buy OnePlus Smartphones On Amazon (Paid Link):      On NewEgg (Paid Link):    On BHPhoto (Paid Link):       Purchases made through some store links may provide some compensation to Linus Media Group. Now this is interesting, so unlike last time, these phones are not differentiated by the pop-up selfie camera on the Pro model. So for the higher price, and thicker, sort of meatier feeling phone, you get a better camera, you get bigger display, and other than that they're kind of shockingly similar. Very curved display, if you're into that sort of thing, and if you're not, well then, it's still got a very 2-and-a-half D curve display. Like their previous devices, OnePlus has included their lightening-fast, under screen fingerprint sensor here. And they've got it in a really ergonomic spot. I like this. It's a really comfortable spot to reach up to, not too low, not too high. And there we are. Now, honestly, I don't find the difference between 90 and 120 Hertz that noticeable in day-to-day use, but that is one of the other big differences between the 8 and the 8 Pro, is this display, when you go into the advanced settings, runs at either 60 or 90 Hertz, whereas the Pro runs at 120 refreshes per second. Something to notice, that unlike Samsung's S20 series, OnePlus has opted to go with a dynamic refresh rate.
